channel.title: For someone reason when I go afk my server crashes in about 6 hours
channel.description:
[code]pure kill is signing onto server. [client-138-pure kill]: pure kill is logging in again. [client-138-pure kill]: pure kill is already online. ClientHandler: Accepted from 86-41-193-68.b-ras1.lmk.limerick.eircom.net:51634 pure kill is signing onto server. [client-139-pure kill]: pure kill is logging in again. [client-139-pure kill]: pure kill is already online. ClientHandler: Accepted from 76.81-166-20.customer.lyse.net:2033 me skillz is signing onto server. [client-140-me skillz]: me skillz is logging in again. [client-140-me skillz]: me skillz is already online. ClientHandler: Accepted from 86-41-193-68.b-ras1.lmk.limerick.eircom.net:51635 pure kill is signing onto server. [client-141-pure kill]: pure kill is logging in again. [client-141-pure kill]: pure kill is already online. ClientHandler: Accepted from 86-41-193-68.b-ras1.lmk.limerick.eircom.net:51636 pure kill is signing onto server. [client-142-pure kill]: pure kill is logging in again. [client-142-pure kill]: pure kill is already online. ClientHandler: Accepted from 76.81-166-20.customer.lyse.net:2034 Exception in thread "Thread-0" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space at client.<init>(client.java:11171) at PlayerHandler.newPlayerClient(PlayerHandler.java:44) at server.run(server.java:178) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
It gets no nulls but they do mass I think :confused: Also when I turn my auto restarter on it never does it right when i go afk I look and it doesn't restart because the server is runing already.

item.title: For someone reason when I go afk my server crashes in about 6 hours
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“ugetpkd, post:9, topic:155724”][quote author=Vladie link=topic=212504.msg1857654#msg1857654 date=1193811639]
Get an auto restarter. They’re very helpful.
[/quote]
That is what I used let me try it again I will show you what it gives me.[/quote]
Try my Antilag class, it is sexy. =]

[code]/**

  • Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
  • User: Yz85Racer
  • Date: 31/10/2007
  • Time: 16:11:23
  • File: Antilag.java
    */
    // Antilag class, rewritten by Yz85Racer - Free to use, post, and call it your own, I don’t care, it’s not much anyway =].

import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;

public class Antilag {

public int resetTime = 0;

public void resetServer() {
	System.out.println("Server now reseting - Yz85Racer");
	PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
	System.out.println("Game successfully saved - Yz85Racer");
	resetTime = 0;
	while(closeServerListener()) {
		runServer();
    }
}

public boolean closeServerListener() {
	if(Server.clientListener != null) {
		try {
			Server.clientListener.close();
			return true;
		} catch(IOException e) {
			return false;
		}
	}
	Server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
	Server.clientListener = null;
	return true;
}

public static boolean runServer() {
	try {
		String os = System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase();
		if(os.contains("win")) {
			System.out.println("Detected server host using operating system : " + os);
			String file = "./runserver.bat";
			File runFile = new File(file);
			if(runFile.exists()) {
				Runtime.getRuntime().exec(file);
				return true;
			} else {
				System.out.println("Something went wrong starting server!");
				return false;
			}
		} else if(os.contains("lin")) {
			System.out.println("Detected server host using operating system : " + os);
			String linuxFile = "./runserver.sh";
			File runFile = new File(linuxFile);
			if(runFile.exists()) {
					Runtime r= Runtime.getRuntime();//reference to runtime java environment
					Process P = null;
					P = r.exec(linuxFile);
					BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(P.getInputStream()));
					String fromShell = null;
					while((fromShell = in.readLine()) != null) {
						System.out.println(fromShell);
						return true;
					}
			} else {
				System.out.println("Something went wrong starting server!");
					return false;
			}
		} else {
			System.out.println("Error reseting server");
			return false;
		}
	} catch(IOException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	return false;
}

public void process() {
	resetTime++;
	if(resetTime >= 350000) {
        resetServer();
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
